Patent Information.Patent Title: Use of antimicrobial proteins and peptides for the treatment of otitis media and paranasal sinusitis.
Patent Information.Abstract: The pharmaceutical composition and a method of treatment of infectious diseases, such as otitis media, paranasal sinusitis, labyrinthitis and meningitis are described. The composition comprises EP2E or homologues thereof.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Beta-defensin 8 (BD-8, mBD-8; Defensin, beta 8; Rodents, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacterium:Staphylococcus aureus;Gram-negative bacteria:Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Escherichia coli, Burkholderia cepacia.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: The antimicrobial activity against S. aureus, E. coli and B.cepacia is reduced in raised concentration of NaCl, but its action against Pseudomonas aeruginosa is independent of NaCl concentration.

Literature.Title: Cloning and characterization of mBD-7 and mBD-8, two novel mouse beta-defensins.
Literature.Author: Conejo-Garcia JR, Nehls MC, Wattler S, Bals R, Heitland A, Kluever E, Liepke C, Adermann K, Forssmann WG.

Literature.Title: Structure determination of human and murine beta-defensins reveals structural conservation in the absence of significant sequence similarity.
Literature.Author: Bauer F, Schweimer K, Klüver E, Conejo-Garcia JR, Forssmann WG, Rösch P, Adermann K, Sticht H.

Literature.Title: Identification and characterisation a novel murine beta defensin related gene.
Literature.Author: Dorin J.R.,Cross S.H.,Kilanowski F.M.,Rolfe M.,Morrison G.M.
